text:
Hi Guys

is there a way to get email content based on smart rules over the API
This message was deleted.
which endpoint are you using?
the `/search` endpoint?
if so that endpoint definitely doesn't have a 5 object limit
send the request you're using
This one: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/{object}/search>
can you share your request body?
Lol
lol you're good bro
knew there was something off
it's limit is 10000
with 100 per page
Hello -
Yeah unfortunately we don't have dedicated IP addresses, or a dedicated domain, that requests from workflows come from. These change all the time as we scale up and down or upgrade our infra

Hey <@U03SQ56P40M>! Our community is happy to help here, but we'd ask that you please refrain from strong language in your posts. Please see our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|Code of Conduct>. I'm going to delete your posts with strong language but feel free to re-post anything with that language omitted.

I have been trying to setup an API for bulk upload of contacts - create and update.  I am using Azure Data Factor and do not know how to setup the file layout.  I have read the HubSpot instructions.  They work for Postman but do not translate to Azure.  Has anyone done this?  Thanks Bryan
I am trying to find the place 'importRequest' - Thanks Bryan

<@U01QVR44MEY> Hey I changed the body of my request and I'm still having issues.  This is the body: `{`
  `"filterGroups": [`
    `{`
      `"filters": [`
        `{`
          `"values": [`
           `"value_1",`
           `"value_2",`
          `],`
          `"propertyName": "custom_object_property",`
          `"operator": "IN"`
        `}`
      `]`
    `}`
  `],`
  `"properties": [`
    `"custom_object_property"`
  `],`
  `"limit": 100`
`}`  getting 0 results when the properties are in HubSpot. I did the same API call with email contacts and this worked but not with custom objects
yep and you've also tried this same filter in HubSpot and you see different results?
Nop, just empty results
you ran the same filter in HubSpot ui though right?
Yup, the values are in HubSpot. Something weird is happening or I'm missing something.
how many objects is the filter in HubSpot returning?

Hi
I am creating contacts through the API and setting their telephone numbers to internationally formatted values.  When I go to the UI and click on the contact's telephone number it gives me the option to "Apply formatting", I apply it and all is good and the format is the same as i supplied via the API.  How can I get HS to automatically accept my pre-formatted telephone numbers without manually clicking  "Apply formatting" for each one?  Thanks
I'm sending 42 values in my request. I double checked the filter in HubSpot and I'm getting the 42 results ;(
very interesting, just ran a test on my end and see the results I'm looking for
what does the response look like?
{ "total": 0,  "results": []}
and you are using the internal property values right? not the labels
I tried with a different property and seems to work
Yup, the internal values. I guess there is some kind of issue with that property.
really don't know how much I can help without being in your portal
Hi! Anybody has migrated the ecommerce bridge api recently? Since the external_object_id cannot be used anymore, how are you doing to deduplicate records?

From this API documentation: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/get_events>
where do I find appID?  What we trying to do use this api to get all campaigns and email events for transactional emails.

I recognize this is legacy and wanted to also ask if there another API call to use?
Following

The documentation for Private App Access Tokens is inaccurate (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>) I cannot for the life of me figure out where to find the access token for my new private app. I can't make any API calls without it
it's in the settings page, under private apps
I don't see anything inaccurate

Hi everyone o/

Is it possible to create a line_item via API and then associate it with a deal?

I am trying to create it through the endpoint POST <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/line_items> but it just keeps creating it without the values I sent through the body request (such as name, price and quantity) and I don’t know why :((
it's going to be a POST request
oh sorry I wrote i wrong lol but I was using the POST request :sweat_smile:
do you have an example of your request?
and is the object id being returned?
Here’s an example of the request. and yes, the object id is being returned
You'll want to use `amount` instead of `price`
At least that's what my initial reaction is
and are you trying to create this line item from a product or do you want to just create a completely new one
also it shouldn't impact it, but you might put the price in as a number instead of a string if the amount property doesn't work
Thank you, I was attempting to access the page from a developer account, which does not accurately reflect the docs. I tried from a test account and all is expected
Yep developer accounts don't have private apps, glad you figured it out
Hello is there a way to get smart rule content over the API?
